page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT AROUND DRUMOAK
page.content: Employment has changed radically over the years in Drumoak due to increasing mechanisation and the discovery of North Sea Oil. Mechanisation has meant that the farming industry does not need the large labour force it once used. Farmers now use only casual labour at peak periods like harvest time and some small holders even have other full time employment. The oil industry has brought new jobs to the area, engineers making up a large part of the work force. Despite this fact non oil-related industries still employ the largest number of people living locally, mainly the building industry and other craftsmen, some of whom run their own small businesses. Unemployment is not common in Drumoak.
